detailsOfAchievement: Habitat Forum (INHAF) successfully developed a study and a research methodology based on themes such poor defining poverty line, investment watch, â€˜how city delivers its entitlements for poorâ€™. We also compiled and printed a book covering six organizations of informal sector workers from Pune in Marathi and English languages. Along with other partners and stakeholders INHAF organized â€˜Zopadpatti Punarvasan Parishadâ€™ in Pune to address issue of rural and urban housing. We gave presentation to Govt of India in addressing its role at Habitat III which is the United Nations Conference on Housing and Sustainable Urban Development to take place in Quito, Ecuador, in October 2016. INHAF has taken initiative in developing strategy for Indian Civil Society based on themes and issues which are uncovered in national policies, programs and development actions. INHAF with its partner organization has piloted a project on promotion of bamboo as an alternative construction material for affordable housing for poor Way Forward Chennai is one of our initiatives on strategy development for resilient cities using case study of Chennai for its recent floods.

detailsOfAchievement: We are working on the issues like Health, Education, Women empowerment, Self Help Groups, Agriculture and Environment. Especially our focus is to provide equal chances to youth of unorganized sector, women, children and economically deprived community in business, education and health. Encouraging training program for people to develop independent business was organized by organization. We are also joined with activities like natural resources management and agriculture. Our main strength lies in our experienced team thus we can implement our program successfully from grassroots level. During establishment of organization we have started our work in Amreli district to make change in situation of health and education as per founderâ€™s ideas and vision, later on we have included work of primary education and reproductive and child health activities. We have been discussed to join livelihood program for women after seven years of establishment and started vocational training for women. Organization also included activities of built house for Agariya who are living on peripheral area of sea, renovation of historical places and educational researches. Now as on experience organization started activities of natural resource management, formation of SHGs for self-employment and skill development trainings. We have also joined with capacity building activity of Gram Sanjivani Samiti in Bardoli block of Surat district.
